DOC.brief_summary: The aim study determine effect aerobic exercise maternal offspring vascular health .
DOC.brief_title: Physical Activity Vascular Health During Pregnancy
DOC.detailed_description: The study comprise randomise pilot trial ass effect moderate intensity exercise intervention maternal offspring vascular health . Participants recruit first trimester ( T1 , 10-12 week ' gestation ) , randomize either 24-week , structure partially supervise , gym-based exercise intervention begin trimester 2 ( T2 ) trimester 3 ( T3 ) , non-exercise control group receive normal clinical care . The inclusion non-exercise control group critical allow u create understanding adaptation vascular system normal ( non-exercising ) pregnancy , also determine physical activity sedentary behaviour engage normal healthy pregnancy . All participant ask attend laboratory Liverpool John Moores University 4 separate occasion synchronise end point trimester within four week delivery . Maternal vascular health , physical activity , sedentary behaviour fitness assess time point throughout pregnancy fourth visit comprise offspring vascular assessment . The investigator also gain information delivery outcomes include pre-term delivery , complication labour , induction labour , caesarean section post-partum haemorrhage via medical note Liverpool Women 's NHS Foundation Trust .
DOC.criteria: Healthy pregnant female No history cardiovascular disease , gestational diabetes preeclampsia Single gestation Not medication affect cardiovascular health A nonsmoker least 6 month Participating structure exercise < twice/week BMI < 30kg/m^2 Royal College Obstetricians Gynaecologists ( RCOG ) contraindication pregnancy Pregnant invitro fertilisation ( IVF ) exercise BMI > 30kg/m^2 > 45 year old Structured exercise > twice/week Multiple gestation Disability prevent ambulation Currently smoke smoke within past 6 month prior pregnancy NonEnglish speaking woman
